reviews.review_text: This is pretty much a giant leap backwards for idle clicker games. First off it is P2W. Let me explain: -Each campaign lasts 24hours. -After each campaign there will be a scoreboard for the highest scoring player. (pseudo competetive) -Each campaign (24h) has a limit of 5 boosts. (ranging from X more votes per click / sec. etc. etc. you know the drill) -With a single payment you have unlimited acess to those boosts. (Hence P2W in a pseudo competetive game)  Secondly: -8bit graphics, totally retro bruh (♥♥♥♥ off you lazy ♥♥♥♥) -Nothing UI or gameplaywise is innovative -Lacks so much more options the rest of the idle games already have implemented  If that's not enough, play the game and see for yourself pay a few cents and climb to the #1 spot because why play the game when you can pay the game to play it for you, eh? Game developer do not want people to play their game and eventually make a living out of it now they want your money and happen to be game developer. But nowadays who isn't an indie dev, eh?  I am well aware that developer have to eat and feed their children. But if your microtransactions give you a enormous advantage (borderline cheat) like that, you and your offspring are better off starving. R.I.P. Harambe  Edit 1: to those who chose to be and identify as mentally challenged:  Let me do the thinking for you because apparently it hurts you a lot when you even try.  Example A.: Dude A spends money on the game and buys multiplier and has acess to INFINITE amounts of boosts. Dude A can therefore kickstart his placement in the leaderboards of each campaign (every 24 hours) as if he was playing for days / weeks and easily reach the no. 1 spot.  Example B.: Dude B doesn't spend money on the game and plays it like the GAME ALLOWS HIM TO. Meaning he has to wait 24 hours until he can get his 1 (one , O N E) multiplier and is limited to 5 boosts each campaign (5 boosts within 24 hours). After each campaign Dude B is ♥♥♥♥ed and not even mentioned he exists on the leaderboards because the whales are circlejerking around.  In conclusion: the game is P2W.  Does the leaderboard matter? To me? No. To other people it might be the only thing left that gives them a hard on seeing themselves on a leaderboard of ~400 players because they have spent money with a flick of the wrist. What does it matter if someone loses the game? If they have lost because someone else pays off the jury, then it's cheating in this case P2W.  This review is by no means a 'stop enjoying what i don't enjoy' this is a 'BEWARE! P2W AHEAD' warning. I cannot possible tell people what to do or not to do. All I am saying is that it is POSSIBLE to pay extra money to come ahead of other players. Which in itself is discouraging for a lot of people.  What's sad is that this game came out on steam when the election is in its final stage and if the worst outcome truly emerges then we will witness the season finale of the United States of America and a bunch of crooks make a quick dime for a simplified product.
It is unclear how you are to progress in the game. Each game lasts 24 hours of real world time and not game time, so you are punished for having a life outside of this basic clicking game.

Campaign Clicker is one of the newest clicker styled games in the over-saturated market that spawned since the monumental success of AdVenture Capitalist. This particular title centers around the fad of the popular United States election current event. It's a battle of Democrats versus Republicans, and you get to choose the side that you want to be on. There are even unlockable candidates that can be purchased with in-game coins, that are obtained through campaign victories.  The general idea is that the more clicks you make, the more votes you get. You can make your clicks count for more votes by spending votes on fingers, which you can have up to 100 of; effectively making each click worth 100 votes by the time it's fully upgraded. You can also spend votes on upgrading your campaign, such as buying more billboards, newspaper ads, social media experts, etc.; these go towards upgrading the amount of votes you get per second. Each campaign lasts for a full 24 hours, in which time you will need to earn a staggering 323,214,999 votes to win. Upon winning you get 10 coins that will unlock new campaign characters.  Campaign Clicker is by far one of, if not the worst, entry into the newly founded clicker genre. The content is boring, the gameplay abysmal at best, and the pay to win model unforgivable. In fact when the game first announced that I could buy boosts and multipliers, it popped up right in the middle of the screen and I nearly accidentally purchased a $4.00 USD boost. Without these boosts, winning the campaign is nearly impossible, even with the aid of an autoclicker. You do start each campaign with some free boosts, but you can only use five in the course of 24 hours.  If you don't care so much about that, take into account that the game CONSTANTLY freezes, becomes unresponsive, and crashes; even when just idling and not clicking. Occasionally these faults cause you to lose a large chunk of votes that you've accumulated. I initially downloaded this to idle it for the card drops, which is proving problematic in itself. So even if you're like me, and you just want to get some trading cards, you may want to think again since merely idling is troublesome. If you're a fan of clickers in general, this one is horrific in every way imaginable. Just steer clear.   Rating:  0.5/5.0  - Abysmal, avoid it like the plague.

This is one of the best games I've played in years, and it didn't cost me a dime! It just goes to show that you don't need to look for those $60 price tags to find very high-quality, fun games anymore. Somebody call the newspaper; free games are fun now!  Extremely reasonable upgrade fees. For only $5.99 you can get 5 multiplier tokens (essential) and for $0.49 you are permitted to use the on-screen upgrades. Other games charge you ridiculous amounts to use the on-screen upgrades. 50 cents? That's chump change (or should I say TRUMP change LOL)  On top of being addicting and fun, this game is a great educational resource. I learned how campaigning works through the game's intricate campaign click strategy algorithms. You have to decide how to spend your votes in order to optimize making more votes. Do you want to run a grassroots campaign or save up for social media clicking. It's more expensive, but it will allow you to get your message out to more voters. It's not as simple as it sounds!  Game features that you simply WILL NOT find in other games: - Cartoons of today's leading politicians - GREAT soundtrack - Pro-Israel  Why are you still reading this? GO DOWNLOAD IT RIGHT NOW!
